title: Art History and Visual Culture
description: This course takes a case study approach to examining the role of the art object as a means of communication within the history of visual culture. Particular attention will also be paid to the unique properties of a range of diverse media, both traditional and new.

title: Visual Culture Seminar
description: This fourth-year honours seminar leads students through a variety of topics in the theory and history of visual culture. Through class discussions, readings, and presentations, students will engage in an interdisciplinary dialogue around what constitutes visual culture today and how to analyze it.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: VCULT 300; Level at least 3B Visual Culture Honours students. Antireq: FINE 490, 496

title: Advanced Visual Culture Seminar
description: This fourth-year level advanced visual culture seminar is designed to focus student research skills toward the development of a thesis project.
